page.title: 19SPORT IN FYLINGDALES
page.content: The cricket team has its own ground and pavilion. It plays in a village team league and at the end of the season they are usually middle of the points table. The Fylingdales football team share the cricket pitch in Winter but they are never very successful. We also have a quoits team which plays at the park. The idea is to hoop the quoits, which are heavy metal rings, over the pins which are set in clay. The pitch is two metres long and the players take turns to hoop the pins. In Robin Hoods Bay is the tennis club where anyone may play. Children over fourteen can play bowls on the green and those who play well could be chosen for the team which plays in the league of village clubs.
